Sentencas: A protective coating layer on chromium-containing interconnects is critical for preventing chromium diffusion and slowing the increase in area specific resistance (ASR) in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: In-situ formed CuFe2O4 spinel coating by electroplating method for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: In the present work, a stoichiometric CuFe2 alloy is successfully electroplated on the surface of SUS 430, and a CuFe2O4 spinel coating is formed through in-situ thermal oxidation.
Titulo: In-situ formed CuFe2O4 spinel coating by electroplating method for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: Density functional theory calculations and COMSOL simulations are employed to reveal the mechanism of CuFe2 alloy electroplating.
Titulo: In-situ formed CuFe2O4 spinel coating by electroplating method for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: The dense CuFe2O4 coating effectively blocks the outward volatile Cr species and suppresses the ASR increase in a long-term test (at 800 degrees C in the air for 1000 h).
Titulo: In-situ formed CuFe2O4 spinel coating by electroplating method for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: Furthermore, the practical application of CuFe2O4-coated SUS 430 is evaluated using a three-electrode cell, showing much improved durability due to the mitigated chromium poisoning.
Titulo: In-situ formed CuFe2O4 spinel coating by electroplating method for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: These results demonstrate that the CuFe2O4 coating significantly reduces the out-migration of Cr species from the interconnects.
Titulo: In-situ formed CuFe2O4 spinel coating by electroplating method for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: This work provides guidance on electroplating strategy for the future development of alloy coatings for SOFC interconnects.
Titulo: In-situ formed CuFe2O4 spinel coating by electroplating method for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect
